ygData.subject: Re: balancing EQ with real life :)
ygData.msgSnippet: Okay, to be honest, I don t balance well at all.  It s a chronic struggle and I consider EQ an addiction with a WHOLE LOT of rationalization why I can play it.
ygData.messageBody:
Okay, to be honest, I don't balance well at all. It's a chronic
struggle and I consider EQ an addiction with a WHOLE LOT of
rationalization why I can play it. If he is playing the raids on Fear
and Hate and the dragon raids then he really is committing himself for
the duration of the raid. At the earlier levels one can log on and log
off pretty freely as there is less coordination with other people. But
the raids require commitment.

If he IS level 50, he doesn't really have to play every night. He is at
the maximum level. One suggestion would be to set aside one night a
week as "date night" where the two of you spend time together. And,
yes, you might look into getting your own EQ account. It really doesn't
cost that much. Not so you can spend more time playing with him as much
as so you can learn a bit more about the environment and community.

Or just hang out with him. There is enough downtime in the game that I
often read a book while other watch TV while playing. It is interrupted
conversation, but it is possible to have.

At any rate, good luck. I don't know that there is a solution,
honestly. If I had a real life group like SCA I might enjoy that more.
I suspect it is a LOT healthier. <sigh> Oh well, good luck.

Iceiallana Forestfury
Brell

Jennifer McNitt wrote:

> From: Jennifer McNitt <jenmcnitt@...>
>
> I was just wondering how you all balance playing EQ with real life
> roles/duties.
>
> I'm not actually a EQ player myself, but my husband is. Since he
> started to
> play EQ (over 6 months ago), we haven't done as much as we used to
> together.
> Before EQ he played Ultima Online but was able to log whenever he felt
> like
> it in that game.
>
> With EQ it seems like he has to be on longer to get anywhere in the
> game and
> he isn't able to log whenever he wants to. He is a level 50 ranger
> and is
> in the Plain of Fear a lot right now. Due to the spawn rates he has
> to stay
> up late, and be online every day. He even has taken off work
> periodically
> to be in the game more.
>
> I know a lot of the game just because it is mostly all of what we talk
> about
> right now. :)
>
> I understand online role playing as I ran my own computer BBS for over
> 5
> years. I was an avid MUD/MUSH player myself for a while and did play
> Ultima
> Online for a bit too. My husband and I actually meet on my BBS when
> I was
> on college dated for about 3 years and have been married 3 1/2 years.
> We
> are both avid computer game players. Due to life/new hobbies/etc. I
> haven't
> been in online games myself for the past 3 years.
>
> I really don't mind him playing EQ as I know it is what he likes to
> do. We
> have an understanding that I let him play EQ and I spend my free time
> doing
> SCA (medieval re-inactment group) activities.
>
> For Christmas all he wanted was anything EQ related. He also tells me
> if I
> want to spend more time with him, that I should get a EQ account
> myself (we
> have a home network which would make this possible). :)
>
> I was just wondering how others balance their life with their
> significant
> others and EQ playing.
>
> Thanks!
>
> Jen
>
>
>
